website_summaries.verdict: These seeds are a must-have for sunflower lovers, especially those who want a variety in one pack that offers an array of sizes and vivid colors.
pros: Bulk non-GMO sunflower seeds that include more than 15 varieties, with sizes ranging from one to seven feet in height once mature
Consumers rave about how easy they are to plant and the bold colors that include some bi-colored blooms
cons: Some consumers received packages with less than the advertised 1,000 seeds
Not all seeds are likely to sprout, though this is often due to planting conditions

customer_reviews.title: Beauty
customer_reviews.text: Love these seeds... they bring such a variety of beautiful colors. I ordered them again this year after such a great experience last year 🌻 I highly recommend! (And I have zero experience as a gardener btw!) See pictures:
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2000 in a ditch..
customer_reviews.text: I have an 8 foot by 350 foot ditch along my fence. I grew tired of weed whacking it. So i roto tilled the entirety of the ditch and planted 2 packets of these sunflowers for a total of 2000 seeds. In the front foot of the ditch (closest to the road), I planted 500 love lies bleeding amaranth. So far I'm seeing excellent germination, and I look forward to seeing the flowers. I've done this before with excellent success and I was very happy to find a sunflower mix with so many varieties. Ill update with pictures when everything is in bloom.
customer_reviews.author: The Lint Trap

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful variety!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second year in a row I've bought this mix of 1000 sunflower seeds. I scatter them down the side of my driveway and sit back and enjoy. There are short ones, giant ones, bright yellow ones, rusty red ones! I love their cheerfulness, as does my granddaughter ("yeyow fowas!") and all the neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: gorgeous and plentiful!
customer_reviews.text: These sunflowers made my summer. I posted one photo of one of the variety that grew, but there were many more gorgeous varieties that grew from the packet I purchased. This is a great company that sells legitimate seeds that grow many many sunflowers. I have so many bees and butterflies and even hummingbirds that have flocked to these flowers all summer. I will definitely be buying more for my garden next year. Thank you!!! Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Coclico

customer_reviews.title: I purchased 2 packs of the 1, 000 very ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 packs of the 1,000 very last minute to use as part of the thank you gifts for my son and his fiance's thank you gifts for their wedding shower. I say last minute because we weren't sure exactly what we were going to do, then when we decided, we couldn't find enough seeds to be able to give away to each guest for a decent price. We wound up with a few leftovers, and decided to plant them. In less than a week, we had sprouts. Now the plants are growing by leaps and bounds. We are enjoying the new additions of sunflowers to our garden, and plan to have more next year. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Charrin

customer_reviews.title: Seeds to Panama
customer_reviews.text: Hello I purchased the seeds for the owner of a Hostel in David, Panama. The name of the Hostel is Pacasa. The owner is Josee. She requested me to bring flower seeds to her as I traveled to Panama in June/July of tbis year. She will be planting tbem with the expectation of brightening up the yard and the Hostel area. You will find "Picasa' on the Internet under Hostels, Panama. She was very happy to receive the very nicely packaged seeds. Thank you. G. Jacob Billger
customer_reviews.author: Gordon J. Billger, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Cannot say enough good things !
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I buy a lot from amazon and I hardly ever write reviews but this will be the only company I will ever buy seeds from! Every package I have bought from them did not disappoint me. This is my first time growing sunflowers and you can see they are so beautiful! If I can upload more photos I will.
customer_reviews.author: diane

customer_reviews.title: Best EVER
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why some people say to do anything else then to simply plant them in the ground. We had absolutely gorgeous results by doing just that. We live in the country. Birds didn't touch the seedlings. The only birds that were around them were beautiful goldfinch that fluttered all around the blooms. We planted the entire front of our property, along the fence. People stopped and slowed down to see them all summer. Stunning! Simple. The only thing we did differently was, after about 4-6 weeks, we planted more, between the ones coming up, so that we would have them longer. Love these! They ranged from about 2' to close to 10'. Buy these!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bash

customer_reviews.title: Nice Flowers
customer_reviews.text: Good product. We purchased these seeds as a bridal shower favor. Everyone loved the gifts. We planted a handful of seeds with my toddlers to show them the growing of seeds. He was so amazed that flowers came from seeds. The flowers only took a couple of weeks to produce flowers. It's a nice variety of different flowers.
customer_reviews.author: Jason K

customer_reviews.title: No sunflower field this year
customer_reviews.text: As a veteran sunflower grower, I eagerly prepared my plot and planted all of the seeds. There may or may not have been 1000 seeds but it felt like it while I was planting. I carefully tended the garden but only TWO plants grew from the entire package. I would return the seeds but they were all planted weeks ago so there would only be an empty package.
customer_reviews.author: Norma F.

customer_reviews.title: Rip off
customer_reviews.text: NONE of these grew and I have a huge garden mostly started from seeds. Waste of money. I'm pissed. Tried different soils. Indoor start and outdoor start. Different areas of the yard. Fertilizer. Nothing.....
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: These are beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: My niece died a year ago. She absolutely loved sunflowers, so my mother decided this summer to try and grow them for the first time. She was successful and it made her so happy that she decided she wanted to try growing a wider variety of sunflower seeds. I found the Seed Needs Bulk Package of 1,000+ Seeds, Sunflower Crazy Mixture 15+ Varieties (Helianthus annuus) Non-GMO Seeds and bought them for her right away. She is delighted with all the varieties and colors and can't wait to start growing them all. They are going to be amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Maria E. Barry

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I planted these in April. Only three sprouted. Planted again in May....nothing. Made one more attempt the first of June....nothing. Must be a bad batch of seeds. Planting season is over now. Will not order again.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT SEEDS
customer_reviews.text: So happy with these seeds. They produced gorgeous, healthy sunflowers - which still have a bit longer before they bloom but here is a photo of what we have so far. Highly recommend these seeds. And the owner of the company is lovely as well, sending a heart felt thank you email of appreciation for my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tati512NYC

customer_reviews.title: I loved growing them this year
customer_reviews.text: I planted these in early April... took a while for them to come up for some reason... my tallest is 9ft... with the biggest head... I loved growing them this year!!
customer_reviews.author: Berrypsycho

customer_reviews.title: TWO TINY BAGS
customer_reviews.text: I was under the impression I was getting THOUSANDS of seeds. Not two tiny bags of 1,000 seeds-- come to find out 1,000 seeds are barley anything at all. This was not even close to filling the project I was working on. So unless you want to grow sunflowers for yourself only, these are tiny packets. Not enough for any project.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the seeds for my son to plant in his garden. He love sunflowers and this variety pack was perfect for him. They began coming up quickly and they grew and blossomed beautifully. It was a nice variety of sunflowers and lots of the seeds grew into plants. I would highly recommend these and have purchased them a second time to be planted again plus I will be purchasing more to plant around my fence line.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Vixen

customer_reviews.title: Duds and a short refund window
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. None of them grew. I'm not able to get a refund as it's outside of the refund window. But how are you supposed to know if they aren't any good if you don't give them time to grow?
customer_reviews.author: moxiegloat

customer_reviews.title: Waiting for the blooms with a head full of hope.
customer_reviews.text: The package of seeds contained a vast collection of different subspecies. I was afraid we were in the throes of drought here in the Central Valley of California but I sowed the hundreds of seeds where they would have their best chance to sprout. And I was rewarded with rain just days later. It has rained about three times since then. If I remember to do it, I will update with photos as the garden progresses. I didn't know that this seed company had such grand practices as what they are doing in support of children's well-being. They can look forward to my continued support. There is always room for another sprout.
customer_reviews.author: Rio Diamond

customer_reviews.title: Great seeds!
customer_reviews.text: I planted these early. Unfortunately they were accidently weed whipped down. So, I replanted. Even with replanting and being late in the season these came up tall, at least 8 feet. They are beautiful I'm honestly shocked. I can't wait until next year I will be planting them everywhere- side of my house, backyard, front yard. And planting them early. If you are hesitating on buying some, don't.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Renee

customer_reviews.title: Amazed
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Adding photo of my beautiful Sunflowers. I will be ordering these again. I was skeptical buying seeds online. I ordered the 500 pack of mixed sunflower seeds. I planted all of them thinking that not a single one would bloom. Well, I was pleasantly surprised. I have about 100 6ft sunflowers. They have not bloomed yet however, it should be any day now. I will buy these again!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: The students at school planted the sunflowers and I am happy to say the plants are alive and well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these seeds for Earth Day. The students at school planted the sunflowers and I am happy to say the plants are alive and well. The students love seeing things grow. Thanks for making a quality product with beautiful photos on the seed packets.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa G. Pechacek

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous Sunflowers!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect, and I went a little overboard planting seeds thinking some wouldn't grow... I was wrong! All of them sprouted within about a week! I started them in Peat Pots April 1st, and transferred to the garden around May 15th (I live in Colorado, so we can't really plant outside until it seems safe with regard to our last snow of the season). I had my first bloom around June 15th! Then, every few days a new one blooms. I absolutely LOVE the variety, they're absolutely gorgeous. Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Shar

customer_reviews.title: Seeds Appear to be of Quality, am still waiting for them to grow though
customer_reviews.text: I am located in hardiness zone 9b (it rarely gets below 55 F here though), and it rains 6-8x per month. When it's not raining, we have a sprinkler system set up. There is a retaining wall in my backyard with some miscellaneous grasses, so I dug some shallow trenches to plant the seeds in March 2019 hoping that a few would pop up. So far, I haven't seen any, not even sprouts (it is May 2019 at time of review), hence I gave the product a 4-star review. I will wait until the end of summer to see if that changes and update my review if so.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonder full variety of seeds
customer_reviews.text: Lots of seeds in the package, lots of cool types of sunflowers. I now have alot more seeds than I bought because I harvested the seeds from the sunflowers. a good purchase if your looking to get a nice variety. 1 seed in this pack can turn into 50 or more seeds if harvested. A fair warning do not start in seed starter trey it doesnt work its best to plant right in the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Danny S

customer_reviews.title: Lots and lots of sunflower seeds
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure which seeds are which, but there are plenty of them! I bought a small packet of sunflower seeds from a major name company locally - out of about 20 in the pack, about half germinated. But these... every seed I have sown has germinated! I'm growing sunflowers this season for the local birds and squirrels, and they will be very happy now. edit- soo many seeds that I started mass planting them. Germination is around 90% so far.
customer_reviews.author: Franz

customer_reviews.title: Preschool Garden of 1,000 Sunflowers
customer_reviews.text: When the kids came into class their first day of preschool they started planting sunflower seeds. We planted in small cups, in big containers, in plastic bags and in sand. When the seeds started to sprout we transferred them in our outside garden. We watch and water each day in anticipation of soon having flowers in bloom. It has been an exercise in science, math, patients and making friends. Thank you for the idea with your 1,000 seeds at a reasonable price. It has been a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: J Doutt

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This my husband’s and mine’s first ever attempt at sunflower gardening. We started during quarantine with terrible soil that had wood chips still left over. We weren’t able to go to the store to get fresh top soil due to the pandemic lockdown. We planted two rows and hoped for the best. They quickly blew up and we were amazed. We’ve been watering every day and making sure they’re properly secured. We’ve only fertilized twice to kill off any weed invaders. My husband has been deadheading everyday as well to make sure we have plenty to plant next season. We love the varieties! Even my grandmother who grew all her life was blown away at our garden.
customer_reviews.author: shesometimessleeps

customer_reviews.title: Zero growth after 1+ month
customer_reviews.text: I tilled, I planted, I watered, I watched, and I waited. Sunflower seeds typically germinate in 7 to 10 days. There has been absolutely no growth in over a month. Don't waste your time getting dirty planting these. It's not worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Julia K

customer_reviews.title: Big and beautiful
customer_reviews.text: So many bugs! They turned out beautiful with most of them well over 5ft!! I am totally buying this again next year only I will be planting these next to my garden so those bees can do some overtime work. I have never seen so many variety's of sunflower, even my friends comment on how pretty they are!
customer_reviews.author: Smiths

customer_reviews.title: Amazing so far!
customer_reviews.text: Finally got a sunny day and Planted my seeds about 9 days ago due to the extra cold and rainy weather here in Michigan and they have already sprouted and there were way more than I expected I’m guessing plenty enough will make it all the way to be satisfied! I do not have a green thumb and just did some research on sunflowers, digging and adding slow feeder fertilizer ( did not add the slow feeding fertilizer in all the areas and more do seem to be growing in the areas I added but plenty grew without it as well) looking forward to seeing how it turns out and will update! :)
customer_reviews.author: Leandra

customer_reviews.title: Quality and price
customer_reviews.text: I am a first time grower of sunflowers. I have an area of land that just needed something, so I decided to grow sunflowers. I went to Amazon after doing research on what to plant and how to plant sunflowers. I found these seeds and decided to buy. I followed the instructions, and watered the entire area every night even after I started seeing the plants growing. I am super happy to watch the sunflowers grow they're so beautiful and so easy
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: a good product for a good cause
customer_reviews.text: I used to grow a LARGE front yard ....full of sunflowers for birds and bees......after several years.....the flowers no longer re-seeded themselves and I had to put some effort into re-seeding last season to get a dwindling bee population some fuel. Not only was I successful...but the sunflowers are beautiful! Bees have a LONG way to recovery numbers...but with some human help......we are on our way (I Hope)......I will continue my quest to plant not only for me...but for bees and birds.....next job...rip OUT the lawn for a clover/white flower lawn....the sunflowers will look great in a sea of clover at their "feet"
customer_reviews.author: Annie "history buff"

customer_reviews.title: Upset didnt grow-Using for a Homeschool Project
customer_reviews.text: It has been about 2 months since planting all the seeds in a rich moist soil; however, only a few germinated and grew. We have grown sunflowers in this spot for years and have been successful. Children are disappointed as they spent so much time preparing the soil and planting the seeds. This will be their first year with a very very small crop. We use the mature seeds for snacking and use the blooms for flower arrangements, pressing, drawing and to fulfill the outer landscape. Sad but we will hope our other flower/vegetable blooms will give us enough to do our homeschool learning and research :(.
customer_reviews.author: erc from MA.

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous Sunflowers of all colors and sizes abound--Just Love these seeds!
customer_reviews.text: I planted these Sunflowers last year for the first time in 5-gallon pots next to our back porch and in our flower garden in our back yard. Wow! What a treat! They start sprouting within a few days and then take off exponentially! Whoaa! I had no idea that sunflowers could be so many beautiful different colors and grow so tall! some of ours grew 9 feet tall! I've planted them again this year and can't wait for these gorgeous flowers to start blooming like wild fire---it's like watching colorful fireworks in slow motion for 2-3 months! Make sure to water them each day (and feed them some plant food each week, too). You'll love them:)
customer_reviews.author: Sjowah

customer_reviews.title: If you want sunflowers, these are the seeds to get!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how great these seeds are! I know everyone that I planted is coming up! So much better than the ones I have been buying in the stores the last 10 or so years!! Never again. I sticking with these from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Helen Williams

customer_reviews.title: very small fraction of them actually grew
customer_reviews.text: I planted 1000 sunflower seeds from this pack and eight of them grew I followed the instructions planted accordingly and only a very small fraction of them actually grew
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: NO FLOWERS
customer_reviews.text: I PLANTED ALL THE SEEDS LIKE THE DIRECTIONS SAID. NOT ONE CAME UP! I PLANTED THEM THE FIRST OF JUNE IT IS NOW JULY 26 AND NO FLOWERS. WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: DIANA LOWE DISALVO

customer_reviews.title: Poor product
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions of how to plant them. Very unsatisfied with results only a few came up. I would not to recommend purchasing this go, to Walmart and get your seeds
customer_reviews.author: Leecia R Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Lots of seeds!
customer_reviews.text: Lots of times when you buy seed packets it is a disappointment when you open the pack to see what little is in there. That is certainly not the case with these seeds! We planted them a little over a week ago and there are little sprouts everywhere! I can't wait to see what grows and I will definitely be back for more!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An abundance of seeds with a variety to match.
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered these seeds, I didn’t fully comprehend that I was actually buying 1,000 seeds. But once the package arrived and I held the pack of seeds in my hands, I quickly realized the magnitude of my planned gardening project. Considering I can’t logistically plant all 1,000 seeds at once, I planted 3 seeds of each variety. Over time, I look forward to planting all 1,000 seeds. In the meantime, I’ll look forward to watching these sunflowers grow and blossom.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Great Results!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased both the sunflower and cosmos mixes last year and had great results from both! Lots of blooms that the butterflies, bees, and hummingbirds couldn't get enough of! Reordered this year to plant along the border of our church's community garden to expand on the butterfly garden there.
customer_reviews.author: Chris King

customer_reviews.title: Understand that seeds are mixed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these with the understanding the seeds were mixed - so short, medium, and tall varieties all in the same package. I have a large enough area where this won't be a concern but if you are looking to plant them out from a fence in rows graduated by height, this won't be the product for you. But had I purchased individual packs to get the different heights I would have paid 2X more so this was a good deal for me economically. If they are grow, mission accomplished.
customer_reviews.author: Jer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sunflowers to add to your garden!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this seed packet at the end of February, and planted the seeds in the beginning of March. It is now early June and my garden is bursting with beautiful sunflowers!!!! There are so many different colors and sizes to enjoy. So easy to grow!!! I have one that is 12 feet tall with the largest sunflower I've ever had. Great buy and great deal. I highly recommend these seeds.
customer_reviews.author: karebr9011

customer_reviews.title: Great germination rate
customer_reviews.text: I started seeds in a large pot outside 3 weeks ago the germination rate is very good. I started a second set of seeds in the pot about 2 weeks ago and about 3 dozen seeds in transplant pots last week and many of those have germinated as well. The first batch is about a foot tall now, I live in Central Texas and we had a frost in late March but the sunflower plants are still in great shape. I anticipate bud break in the next few weeks, about the time that my bluebonnets are all dead so very timely. I love sunflowers and so do the bees. They are my go to summer annual.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great germination & vigor
customer_reviews.text: As the title says, germination rate is excellent and the plants form sturdy stems pretty fast. You can also tell all the different varieties just by looking at differences in color, shape, and height (growth rate) of the seedlings in case you didn't separate all the different looking seeds before planting :)
customer_reviews.author: Aen

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite thing is watching the different varieties open! The smaller varieties are growing well, but haven't budded yet. (My pic of the one I call a "chocolate sunflower" is taken at night. But it really is a rich orange/brown color!) One thing I'm really appreciating is how sturdy the stalks are. I bought 6' stakes for them because Oklahoma winds can be so fierce. But the stalks are doing just fine without help from me. Definitely a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: J. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two packages since my first experience was great! I have sunflowers as tall as 14 feet! I wish they could indicate in the packaging which seeds give the tallest, the most colorful, the thickets sunflower. It would be nice to have those seeds in separate bags with a picture showing what they would look like. Since there is no easy indication, then it is a matter of chance to get the most colorful next to the tallest, etc, etc..
customer_reviews.author: CORA ZAOS

customer_reviews.title: What are you waiting for? Order now!!!
customer_reviews.text: Stunning gorgeous plentiful! Easy to grow. I actually over planted because I wasn’t sure what to expect. Every thing I planted grew into a gorgeous plant with copious blooms. The pollinators LOVE these and the pollen is actually medicinal for bees. This is so important in helping our bees thrive. I actually bought some to send to family and they were thrilled. Thank you for a wonderful variety that kept us surprised and very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Edith

customer_reviews.title: Love these - super easy & extremely high germination!!!
customer_reviews.text: There are a TON of seeds in this package!! They have all taken and are growing. Seriously - these were very easy. I literally just pushed the seed into the grown and within 3 days I saw little green sprouts! You do have to water but it’s been raining for the last 2 days and they came out on their own. I highly recommend these seeds. Great seed to teach children with or to plant in an area that needs a little something extra!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super excited!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t respond to the easy to grow yet, though just within a week some are already germinating. What I will say is if anyone can kill a plant it’s me! Little to no experience in this department but I’m trying! Packaging is great, the quantity of seeds was not short and I’m really excited about what is to come. If everything turns out right, they have a life long customer! One great thing about this company is that they give back to children that are in need of food! I haven’t looked into how much is donated per sale.
customer_reviews.author: NoName

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Variety of Seeds!
customer_reviews.text: So many varieties of sunflower! From small to large and everything in between! They are just now germinating and I cannot wait to see the different colors and varieties. Fast shipping, beautiful packaging and an abundant amount of seeds. I will update with pics!! Highly recommend this buy so far though!
customer_reviews.author: Maunty

customer_reviews.title: Grows!
customer_reviews.text: I got my seeds in the mail. I put them in the ground by using a flower bulb digger making little Dixie cup holes in the ground. We then added potting soil and a couple seeds. We finished each row off with a nice miracle Gro watering. I’ve watered the seeds about every 2-3 days and they’ve sprung up! If any didn’t germinate I am not aware as it was not many if any. Good product! Not for eating🙂👍
customer_reviews.author: E B Fricks

customer_reviews.title: We had a successful 70% germination rate. We sprinkled ...
customer_reviews.text: We had a successful 70% germination rate. We sprinkled seeds over top of some compost, lightly raked it in and allowed the next days rain to water it for us. Can't wait until these beneficials grow amd provide a food source to bees and give us a show during their peak!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon W

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed
customer_reviews.text: There are not easy to grow, I got these August 15th and planted them the same day. All brand new dirt, fertilizer, full sun, and proper drainage. I got a measly inch from a couple of seeds. I purchased two packs. Im very disappointed in the product quality. The positive reviews let me to believe otherwise, I cannot rerun them because I put them all in the dirt hoping they all would sprout
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy to Grow
customer_reviews.text: Amazed. Nothing ever grows in my dirt, not even kale or succulents. As you can see, my soil is very rocky and not the best. I added some potting soil, to see if that would help my dirt, and it seems like it did, however, I do feel like credit should be given to the seeds, as it was easy to grow. As shown in the pictures, I planted a few, less than a week ago, and already have sprouting. Very excited to see which variations sprout. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lovegooddeals

customer_reviews.title: Loose soil, plenty water in early spring is the key👍🏼👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: My husband tractored some cheep dirt to fill in a sinking area next to our yard’s brick, holding wall. Before a rain, I poked the seads in the dirt. Rain storms with massive wind, weed neglect, poor soil and these little seedling persevered through it all. It’s only the start of July, and I planted them in May so they haven’t had time to show all there blooms yet. But the flowering tops have already started leaving little doubt that the plants will be a success.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia A Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great Seeds
customer_reviews.text: We are extremely pleased with the quality and quantity of sunflower seeds we received. We have planted them as directed and I strongly believe we have a 100% germination rate. Although they are still growing and not yet producing flower heads yet, the sunflower stalks are very sturdy and easily withstanding the windy location where I have planted them. We are looking forward to seeing both the beauty of the flowers themselves and the birds they will attract. We will definitely purchase the same seeds from Seed Needs again the future. Great Product !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I will buy these again
customer_reviews.text: I planted these in gravel/clay soil, the worst on my property, and I have an abundance of plants. Many have multiple bloom heads on them. I have the yellow canaries all over the flowers, and I don't think I'll be able to salvage any of the seeds. (I'm cool with that!) I'll buy these again and move them in a better place next year. Keep the water on 'em and they will produce! Awesome seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Chet

customer_reviews.title: Super crazy high gernimation rate!!
customer_reviews.text: My sunflower seedlings are only a few inches high but they all pretty much germinated/sprouted right in the ground after only 4 days... it's up to them now - I'll provide water but they must make their choices - I'll keep you updated! BTW: I purchased more seed from this seller based on the high germination rate of these sunflowers! (Northern California, zone 9: sowed March 31)
customer_reviews.author: Tricia_in_Chico

customer_reviews.title: I think this is s great seed package especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: I think this is s great seed package especially for the price. My sunflowers are still green and growing so I’m not sure if all the colors I’ll get but they seem hardy. I’ve always been told that you’re lucky if 50% of the seeds grow into plants but these are more like 90% for sure. I would recommend this seed package and seller.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Walters

customer_reviews.title: Lovely!
customer_reviews.text: I love the packaging and variety of the sunflowers. As founder of a non-profit that repurposes event flowers to people in hospice care, my logo is a sunflower image (heliotropeforhospice.org), and I use packets of Seed Needs Sunflowers to thank donors. It's a simple, classy way to express a note of thanks along with the receipt for donation! I would also suggest if someone is getting married in the summer or autumn, these sunflower packets would make great "take away" gifts at place settings for your guests!
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Easy to grow
customer_reviews.text: Got these seeds coz i've been wanting grow sunflower. And I Love sunflowers! I'm still a noob for plants but It's very easy to grow. I used the soil I use for my succulents and water it every morning. In just a week it start sprouting. I started it indoors until it matures enough. Can't wait to see it bloom! Also, I just found out that they sponsor kids of less fortunates. Glad I ordered to this awesome seller🙃
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Bad product! Seeds don't grow.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. I followed package directions very carefully, but weeks later not one flower.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Prep the bed, hand sprinkle the seeds, lightly rake, water in. Excellent results!
customer_reviews.text: With minimum effort I got a variety of sunflowers, many over 8-9 feet tall. They really helped attract pollinators as well. Planted in two locations, residential and vegetable garden. Got a thick crop of sunflowers in both, (very sunny) locations. As a bonus they were used as the back drop for a humming bird feeder in one location. Lots and lots of humming birds!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful! I was not so sure about the red one when it was growing but its very pretty! I have never seen one like that before but I love it! I had soo many more that started to grow fast but the darn chipmunks ate them!
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Mikala

customer_reviews.title: Small but cute packaging
customer_reviews.text: When I saw 1,000 seeds were in the package, I thought it would be a big package but it turned out to be smaller. It would have been cheaper for me to buy smaller seed packets at a big box store. The packaging itself was beautiful. I hope some of these seeds germinate. We have yet to see.
customer_reviews.author: Slater

customer_reviews.title: They are blooming! And beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the many different varieties in the pack. I do not have a green thumb. These seeds took right off and are blooming up a storm. Even with the over 100 degree weeks this summer they show no signs of stress. Watered them infrequently. I planted them in a 5 ft by 12 ft bed....way too close together but my four hens have lived in their shade and enjoyed it. I appreciate the quality of the seeds and customer service. I will order more from Seed Needs!
customer_reviews.author: Gingersmydog

customer_reviews.title: Large, Healthy Sunflowers! As Big as Trees!!
customer_reviews.text: Planted from seeds, first time I’ve ever planted sunflowers. They took about two weeks to germinate. By 6 weeks they looked liked weeds but you could see the flower developing. As soon as warm weather hit and a few rainy days, these exploded, tallest one is over 8 feet. These were planted in an area that gets full sun, I did plant some in an area that gets some shade and those did not do well. They are a great addition to our garden, and we are getting a lot of compliments. Will definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Minnie

customer_reviews.title: Great quality seeds
customer_reviews.text: These sunflowers are great! They are tall, thick, healthy and sturdy...and beautiful! They have been wonderful for our patch and we will definitely be ordering more next year, what a fun variety!
customer_reviews.author: Jess A.

customer_reviews.title: BEST PLANTS AND STURDY
customer_reviews.text: These are planted and in various stages of growth, I have some 4 feet tall and some seedlings with a variety of different sizes growing, I cant wait until they bloom. Very sturdy I live in the southwest with strong winds heat and freeze and they are holding up and thriving
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Anne Walker Pike

customer_reviews.title: These sunflower seeds mostly sprouted well
customer_reviews.text: I put these sunflower seeds in to the ground -- I'm no expert gardener -- in random blank spots on our property, some with plenty of dirt, some with a lot of stones. They mostly seemed to sprout, and I was very encouraged ... but then the deer came by, and within a month or so had eaten every single one of them. I figured they would, but i wanted to give it a shot anyway. So, lovely start, most seeds did sprout quickly. DEER WILL EAT.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Good results
customer_reviews.text: So far, I have good results with these seeds. I planted my seeds several days apart so I can enjoy them longer. As far as I can tell at least the majority have sprouted and I have a few that are already a couple of feet tall. Too soon for blooms but I'm looking forward to seeing the blooms and enjoying them.
customer_reviews.author: JNMNR

customer_reviews.title: healthy, vigorous plants
customer_reviews.text: These seeds sprouted well. I soaked them in water and planted them in small containers before transferring them to the ground. They are very healthy and are starting to bloom. I can't wait to see all of the different varieties! I have more than enough seeds left over for next year and plan to plant more. I like to plant them for the birds, bees and butterflies.
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: I have LOT's of NEW sunflower plants starting to grow.
customer_reviews.text: Planted these seeds along a fence and thought it would be a good place for the growth. Birds can eat and make a mess and I'm hoping that the fallen seeds will replenish themselves next year. But right now, I think about 70% of the seeds have sprouted.
customer_reviews.author: DennisT

customer_reviews.title: Easy to sow, easy to grow. Water and watch!
customer_reviews.text: My yard is a sanctuary for pollinators! Butterflies, hummingbirds, bumble bees, honeybees and other bee types have been happily buzzing about every day since these gorgeous sunny faces popped open. I will be ordering more to put down this fall for Spring because I want them EVERY WHERE! Get these, you won’t be sorry. I’m delighted with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ptofte

customer_reviews.title: Great seeds!
customer_reviews.text: OMG, I've been trying to grow sunflowers along my back wall and I'd haven't had any luck until I got these seeds. I don't have a huge green thumb, I think I'm about average but they started sprouting up like crazy. I ended up putting more than I wanted to because the lady next door feeds the birds and they usually try to eat my seeds. But everything I planted started growing so I've been trying to spread them out a little bit. I'm afraid to thin it out because I don't know which ones are which. Do I need to thin them out? Or will they figure it out on their own? These are really great seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Garcia

customer_reviews.title: 100% Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t be happier with this product. You get a wide variety of seeds and they all grew within a few days of planting them. The first batch I started are now over a foot tall and my second batch is around an inch or two and about ready to be put in the ground. The price is the most reasonable for seeds that I have seen and I’m beyond happy that I purchased them. If you’re having any doubts I hope I can reassure you that this is the product you should choose.
customer_reviews.author: 1SRJ4

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a nice variety of wildflowers that I spread in a cleared wooded area. The sunflowers are brightening my view from the kitchen window. Nice to look out and see so much color. Very good value for high quality seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I wanted to test the waters in the gardening world. I had read that sunflowers were one of the easier flowers to grow, and these seeds are proof of it. I don't have any gardening experiencing at all and I'm not sure I even planted the seeds right (yes I followed the instructions lol) but these plants are growing beautifully. My largest one is already 4ft+ in height with all the others around just below it, and they still haven't bloomed! The seeds were all mixed in the bag, and the quality of the seeds were really great. I can't wait for the flowers to bloom! Thank you Seed Needs!
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Best seeds ever...
customer_reviews.text: All the seeds I've gotten from Seed Needs are the best ever. I used to buy "name brand" seeds. Not any more. From now on it's Seed Needs for my seed needs (I couldn't resist.) Germination rate is almost 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT GERMINATION RATE
customer_reviews.text: As someone with no gardening experience, I was pleasantly surprised that every seed I sowed germinated! I planted directly in the soil on July 20, 2020 in zone 6a. The pictures are from September 7, 2020. I planted a lot more, but the squirrels and birds got to them! I am excited to see the flowers bloom. I wish the seeds were separated or at least came with a chart to identify each one so I could separate myself. Overall the price is more than fair for what you get, so I cannot complain too much. I would definitely purchase these seeds again, and plan to next summer.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Prasad

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and easy to grow :)
customer_reviews.text: So glad I went with this year! And since I’m always googling how long things take to flower I’ll note it took exactly 2 months from planting seeds to these photos. I didn’t bother with soaking - just added some topsoil to my dirt and stuck some seeds in. Appears to have a good germination rate! Going to plant a bunch more today since I have plenty of seeds :) Seeds planted June 28, photos taken August 25.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff and Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: These were beautiful! Most grew very tall unless I planted them in a pot. But they still made some beautiful flowers. I currently have a red headed one that is well over 7ft tall and is finally starting to open. You will not regret buying these. They look so beautiful all together with all the different colors they come in!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.text: easy to sow directly into the ground. i'm pretty sure that i put way too many too close together because i wanted a "field" of sunflowers for a front postage size yard. nevertheless, they have just started showing their faces (i planted them in April, which is late). all of them are forming heads and i look forward to many, many flowers. i will post more photos when more show their faces.
customer_reviews.author: o. ption

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Flowers are on the WAY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I orded the crazy mixture and the mammoth. All seeds sprouted and are almost a foot tall. This was the critical part of the growing process. I'll give the 5th star when I get blooms and my mammoths are towering over me.
customer_reviews.author: T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Growth in 3 days which is a first for me
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had much luck growing plants in my good ole georgia clay soil and I was very shocked that within 3 days my seeds were seedlings and a week later they were all sprouting quite nicely. I've never had seeds that grew this quickly so I had to come and write a review. I just ordered a pack of perennials and this company has excited me and surprised me at the same time. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Nellie Jones

customer_reviews.title: Haven't planted yet but look great for seeds so far
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to write to say shipping was super fast and ordering was easy. Seeds "look" viable, Time will tell once they're planted (come spring) but if you're looking for seeds at an affordable price that LOOK GOOD, so far, order here. They seem like nice folks and the seeds seem to be quality. What more can I say?
customer_reviews.author: Paula J.K.

customer_reviews.title: I love mud sunflowers!
customer_reviews.text: I love my sunflowers! The germination rate was so high I had to then them out so I would plant them spaced assuming they will all sprout. I planted them directly into the ground with a little worm casting mix. They grew fast an happy! A couple of the other varieties are about to bloom and I am excited to see wha color sunflowers they have!
customer_reviews.author: E Smith

customer_reviews.title: These seeds grew better than I thought
customer_reviews.text: These seeds grew better than I thought! I have a fence full of different colored sunflowers and I’m in love! There’s even a couple random super brightly colored ones that pop out here and there, like a solid bright red one. I love the surprise of the colors! Would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: 1000 seeds?
customer_reviews.text: I received this package yesterday and while I didn't count the seeds I am pretty sure there are far fewer than 1000 seeds in the packet. The larger seeds which resemble what typically look like sunflower seeds were at most 50. There were other seeds, much smaller, but no way were there 1000 seeds in this packet. That alone is why I am giving a two-star review. I have no idea how they grow, that will take some time to find out.
customer_reviews.author: James Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous, beautiful and easy to grow 🌻!
customer_reviews.text: This sunflower mix is overwhelming beautiful! I have purchased this mix for the past three years. Every time I get gorgeous beautiful flowers. This year my niece is getting married and she wants sunflowers for her September wedding. I am in charge of growing the flowers. I wouldn't trust any other company with the seed that are sooo easy to grow. I highly recommend these flowers.🌻🌻🌻
customer_reviews.author: Beth C.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful sunflower mixture!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love sunflowers! Was so excited when I found this mixture of various sunflowers because they are all beautiful to me & it was hard to decide on the variety to buy. Sunflower one of the easiest flowers to grow & I am really looking forward to having these beauties in my garden next year!
customer_reviews.author: Lena B.

customer_reviews.title: Mother’s Day Surprise
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my granddaughters who planted them as a surprise for their mother for Mother’s Day since we are under stay-at-home orders and can’t shop for plants. Within 7 days, the seeds had germinated and popped through the soil. They are enthralled. They will be a great size by Mother’s Day! Great science lesson too!
customer_reviews.author: Mary L. Lechleidner

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I hoped this would be a bulk buy (1000+ seeds) but I honestly don't think there was 60 seend in this little pack. I will have to find something else . we are using them as wedding favors "let love grow" but deff will not be enough
customer_reviews.author: kayla

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful variety
customer_reviews.text: Great variety. Had some zinnias in the mix too. Sunflowers aren't hard to grow. Add some compost, loosen up dirt... plant.... water... thin out... then wait. If they don't grow, then you probably buried them too deep, overwatered them so they rotted, or animals ate them. All in all, good mix. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Hoard

customer_reviews.title: 100% Seeds Germination.
customer_reviews.text: The different varieties of seeds that came with the packet was really a delight and the 100% germination rate made this purchase a WINNER. I purchased 2 packs, planted 1 pack directly on the ground and they are about 1/2 foot tall now, surrounding the various fruit trees in my property in AZ. I'm giving the 2nd pack to a friend to beautify his backyard, too. Can't wait to see these plants in the late spring and early summer months. I'm sure they will look fantastic! I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Abe D.

customer_reviews.title: Healthy Seeds
customer_reviews.text: Flowers haven't bloomed yet, but they have sprouted (always a fight with the birds) and are growing big, fast, and look very healthy. I'm excited for summer sunflowers!
customer_reviews.author: ANNA BROWN

customer_reviews.title: Not even 1 sprouted
customer_reviews.text: Not a single seed grew. Its been 3 weeks now and nothing. I planted these seeds with several other sunflower seeds from home depot. The home depot seeds all came up. I had such high hopes for these and now just disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra E Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great seller, great seeds!
customer_reviews.text: I planted them in a big container at the end of May, they came up in 4 days, and I count at least that will be blooming in the next few days. They get lots of sun and need lots a water. But I'm extremely happy. I've planted six different kinds of seeds from this seller and have been thrilled with all of them.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hayes

product_meta.title: Seed Needs Bulk Package of 1,000+ Seeds, Sunflower Crazy Mixture 15+ Varieties (Helianthus annuus) Non-GMO Seeds
feature_bullets: Quality Sunflower seeds packaged by Seed Needs. Intended for the current and the following growing season. Packets are 4" wide by 4.675" tall and come with a full colored illustration on the front side, as well as detailed sowing instructions on the reverse.

Crazy Mixture is a combination of our most popular sunflower varieties. It consists of 10+ Sunflowers, including customer favorites such as: Autumn Beauty, Velvet Queen, Lemon Queen, Red Sun, Evening Colors and more.

This particular mixture of seeds will produce flowering plants that grow to a varying height of 1 foot tall to over 7 feet tall, in colors of red, yellow & orange and will even produce bi-colored blooms.

Grown as an annual flowering plant, Sunflowers will grow quickly, bloom profusely and later die with the first killing frost. Sunflowers are best sown outdoors as a border plant, along fences, or in fields by the masses. They will bloom throughout the summer months and seeds can be collected at the end of the season.

All Sunflower seeds sold by Seed Needs are Non-GMO based seed products and are intended for the current & the following growing season. All seeds are produced from open pollinated plants, stored in a temperature controlled facility and constantly moved out due to popularity.
